titleStmt.title: Reasons shewing that the desires of the cloathiers, and vvoollen manufacturers of England expressed long since in their petition presented to the Parliament (against ingrossing and transporting of wooll and fullers-earth, and that none might use it, but those that make it into manufactures) will not be prejudiciall to the grower; but greatly beneficiall to the generall trade of the whole nation.

Reasons shewing that the desires of the cloathiers, and vvoollen manufacturers of England expressed long since in their petition presented to the Parliament (against ingrossing and transporting of wooll and fullers-earth, and that none might use it, but those that make it into manufactures) will not be prejudiciall to the grower; but greatly beneficiall to the generall trade of the whole nation.

notesStmt.note: Signed and dated at end: By Edmond Rozer in the behalfe of the clothiers of England. February the first. 1648.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
